intro: Onosma stenoloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and blue to purple flowers. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
